Issue.creator: lovesh
Issue.summary: Seed for BLS keys has less than 48 bytes of entropy when prepare_seed is used
Issue.description: In {{crypto/bls/indy_crypto/bls_crypto_indy_crypto.py}}Â , the {{prepare_seed}} takes a seed and if the seed is not 48 bytes in length, it adds a padding with 0s. This method is used when node keys are generated using the scripts {{scripts/init_indy_keys}} or {{scripts/init_bls_keys}}. The method {{init_bls_keys}} is passed a 32 byte seed intended to be used for generating ed25519 keypair. This can be fixed in several ways, HKDF can be used on the 32 byte seed or rather than expecting/generating 32 bytes of seed, expect/generate 48 bytes of seed which are good for creating BLS keys but discard the first or last 16 bytes of the seed and use for ed25519 keypair generation
